p: The associations between state transitions and sociodemographic factors in this study are in line with other studies that found effects of low socioeconomic level [ 40] and migrant status [ 77] on treatment outcomes. In Europe, the association between education level and ART initiation reflects socioeconomic inequality [ 78]. Individuals with home addresses outside the city were less likely to receive ART and more likely to experience pre-ART loss. They are typically in the city temporarily for work. A study conducted at the same clinic found family support as a factor that increased retention [ 79], which migrant workers might lack.
